clothing.name: Leather
clothing.description: Durable and flexible, commonly used for armor, boots, and belts. Often seen in rogue or ranger outfits.

clothing.name: Chainmail
clothing.description: Interlocking metal rings, providing good protection. Used in various types of armor, especially for knights and warriors.

clothing.name: Silk
clothing.description: Luxurious and lightweight, favored by mages and nobles for robes and cloaks.

clothing.name: Linen
clothing.description: Light and breathable, typically used for common wear, undergarments, or mage robes.

clothing.name: Wool
clothing.description: Heavy and warm, often used for cloaks, tunics, and pants, suitable for travel and colder climates.

clothing.name: Fur
clothing.description: Thick and insulating, used for warmth in cloaks, boots, and trims. Common in barbarian or northern character attire.

clothing.name: Brocade
clothing.description: Rich, decorative fabric with raised designs, often seen in noble or royal garments.

clothing.name: Velvet
clothing.description: Soft, with a distinctive feel, used for luxurious clothing and nobility's attire.

clothing.name: Scale
clothing.description: Small, overlapping plates, resembling fish scales. Used in armor for flexibility and protection.

clothing.name: Canvas
clothing.description: Sturdy and heavy-duty, used for durable clothing like pants and jackets, common for adventurers.

clothing.name: Damask
clothing.description: Woven fabric with patterns, seen in high-quality vests, robes, and gowns.

clothing.name: Suede
clothing.description: Soft and luxurious, used for gloves, boots, and caps, popular among rogues and bards.

clothing.name: Tweed
clothing.description: Durable and moisture-resistant, ideal for travel cloaks and scholar attire.

clothing.name: Mesh
clothing.description: Light and airy, used in layers for mystical or exotic outfits.

clothing.name: Gossamer
clothing.description: Sheer and lightweight, often used in elven attire or for magical robes.
